content: Does mathlib know that any linear map from a finite dimensional TVS to a TVS is continuous ? We have docs#linear_map.continuous_of_finite_dimensional for the normed domain case, but I can't find the general TVS version
No, we only have the normed version. But the TVS version shouldn't be really harder.
Anatole Dedecker has marked this topic as resolved.
Thanks -- this is going to come up for finite-dimensional vector spaces over p-adic fields really soon.
@Anatole Dedecker You might want to glance at this old thread: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/Topology.20of.20finite-dimensional.20real.20vector.20spaces

I have a sorry-free proof at branch#AD_findim_TVS. The mathematically interesting part was quite easy because @Sebastien Gouezel's proof was indeed really easy to modify to get the general case, but I had to transfer topological results about quotients of groups to quotient of module (they are not defeq :sad:), which took a bit of time (and means the final result will not be PR-ed immediately).
There was talk before of making them defeq
